  • ph: The code for the ph.x calculation.

  • epw: The code for the epw.x calculation.

  • protocol – The protocol.

aiida_supercon.workflows.aniso module

Work chain for computing the critical temperature based off an EpwWorkChain.

class aiida_supercon.workflows.aniso.EpwAnisoWorkChain(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]

Bases: EpwBaseIntpWorkChain

Work chain to compute the superconductivity based on anisotropic Migdal-Eliashberg theory. This workchain aims to implement the IR representation which allows calculation on low temperatures.

However, this version of epw.x made several changes that are not compatible with the previous versions.

  1. It fix the typo in previous versions, that is, eps_acustic -> eps_acoustic.

  2. The format of crystal.fmt file is changed. Previously it is:

    nat nmode nelec …

    And now it is:

    nat nmode nelec nbndskp …

  3. The epw.x from EPW 5.9 can’t prefix.ukk generated from wannier90. Not sure why but I can’t fix it.

  4. The epw.x from EPW 5.9 will try to read ‘vmedata.fmt’ even if I set vme = ‘dipole’.

    I would suggest to start only from the existing prefix.ephmat folder. But this requires another input code. I would temporarily mute use_ir.

aiida_supercon.workflows.b2w module

Work chain to compute the electron-phonon coupling.

This work chain is refined to accept the parent folders of the Wannier90 and Phonon work chains.

Firstly it will validate the parent folders.

  • If the phonon parent folders are valid, it will use the qpoints from the phonon parent folders.

Then it will check if the wannier90 parent folders are valid.

  • If so, it will check if the kpoints of the wannier90 work chain are compatible with the qpoints of the phonon work chain.

  • If they are not compatible, it will re-generate the kpoints of the wannier90 work chain based on the qpoints of the phonon work chain. Then it will re-run the wannier90 work chain.

  • If the wannier90 parent folders are not valid, it will run the wannier90 work chain from scratch.

If none of the parent folders are provided or are not valid, it will run the Wannier90 and Phonon work chains from scratch.

The first step is to compute the electron-phonon (dvscf) on a coarse grid. I think 0.3A^-1 q-point grid should be good but you can use the same k-point grid (as opposed to twice) so it should be cheaper. This step should be done only once

For this step you need to run

pw.x < scf.in ph.x < ph.in

Once the calculation is done, you need to rename and gather the results in a “save” folder This is done with QE/EPW/bin/pp.py script You just run it as python3 QE/EPW/bin/pp.py you need to provide the prefix name to the script What is very important is that the “save” folder is saved in the AiiDA framework This will be the biggest thing to save and is typically ~ 500 mb to 1 Gb

We can discuss this if we want to keep it or not but if possible, I would say yes Ok then the EPW step starts

  1. Find initial wannier projection

pw.x < scf.in pw.x < nscf.in projwfc.x + wannier steps from Junfeng workflow? -> What we need here is the block of inputs provided to epw.in linked to the wannierization (wdata(1) = “<wannier inputs>” input variable; is basically a vector of input variables that are directly passed to wannier.x)

e.g.

wdata(1) = ‘bands_plot = .true.’ wdata(2) = ‘begin kpoint_path’ wdata(3) = ‘G 0.00 0.00 0.00 M 0.50 0.00 0.00’ wdata(4) = ‘M 0.50 0.00 0.00 K 0.333333333333 0.333333333333 0.00’ wdata(5) = ‘K 0.333333333333 0.333333333333 0.00 G 0.0 0.0 0.00’ wdata(6) = ‘end kpoint_path’ wdata(7) = ‘bands_plot_format = gnuplot’ wdata(8) = ‘dis_num_iter = 5000’ wdata(9) = ‘num_print_cycles = 10’ wdata(10) = ‘dis_mix_ratio = 1.0’ wdata(11) = ‘conv_tol = 1E-12’ wdata(12) = ‘conv_window = 4’

  1. EPW step (in a different folder). You just need to do a soft link to the “save” folder from the above step

You need to do pw.x <scf.in (Could potentially be the same as in step 2) pw.x <nscf.in -> JQ: we can simply use these from the wannier workflow

epw.x < epw1.in

At the end of this step, you have the electron-phonon matrix element in real space This needs to be stored for sure The most important and only big file is “PREFIX..epmatwp” For TiO, this is 872 Mb … From this file you can interpolate to any fine grid density

I mean use for next calculation but you may want to keep it in order to do more convergence later for example if you find that a 40x40x40 grid is not enough you dont want to redo step 1 and 2 to get 60x60x60

Files to save:

ln -s ../epw8-conv1/crystal.fmt ln -s ../epw8-conv1/epwdata.fmt ln -s ../epw8-conv1/<prefix>.bvec ln -s ../epw8-conv1/<prefix>.chk ln -s ../epw8-conv1/<prefix>.kgmap ln -s ../epw8-conv1/<prefix>.kmap ln -s ../epw8-conv1/<prefix>.mmn ln -s ../epw8-conv1/<prefix>.nnkp ln -s ../epw8-conv1/<prefix>.ukk ln -s ../epw8-conv1/<prefix>.epmatwp (Note: quite big file!) ln -s ../epw8-conv1/vmedata.fmt ln -s ../epw8-conv1/dmedata.fmt ln -s ../epw8-conv1/save (Is basically the save folder from step 1)

  1. EPW interpolation to get Eliashberg Tc

epw.x < epw2.in epw2.in

and basically here you can change the fine grid in epw2.in to converge things This run can be done in a different folder but you need to soft link a number of files from the previous calculation 2.

class aiida_supercon.workflows.b2w.EpwB2WWorkChain(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]

Bases: ProtocolMixin, WorkChain

Main work chain that orchestrates the Wannier90OptimizeWorkChain, PhBaseWorkChain and EpwBaseWorkChain.

This work chain is designed to transform the electron-phonon matrix from the Bloch basis (coarse grid) to the Wannier basis.

SOURCE_LIST = {'epw': ['crystal.fmt', 'dmedata.fmt', 'epwdata.fmt', 'dmedata.fmt', 'aiida.kgmap', 'aiida.kmap', 'aiida.ukk', 'out/aiida.epmatwp', 'save'], 'ph_base': ['DYN_MAT/dynamical-matrix-*', 'out/_ph0/aiida.dvscf1', 'out/_ph0/aiida.q_*/aiida.dvscf1']}
classmethod define(spec)[source]

Define the work chain specification.

generate_reciprocal_points()[source]

Generate the reciprocal points.

classmethod get_builder_from_protocol(codes, structure, protocol=None, overrides=None, wannier_projection_type=WannierProjectionType.ATOMIC_PROJECTORS_QE, w90_chk_to_ukk_script=None, band_kpoints=None, **kwargs) → ProcessBuilder[source]

Return a builder prepopulated with inputs according to the previous Wannier90OptimizeWorkChain and PhBaseWorkChain and protocol for other namespaces. :param codes: A dictionary of codes for the different calculations. Should be in the following format:

{

‘pw’: code pw.x, ‘ph’: code ph.x, ‘epw’: code epw.x, ‘pw2wannier90’: code pw2wannier90.x, ‘wannier’: code wannier90.x,

}

Parameters:

  • structure – the StructureData instance to use.

  • protocol – protocol to use, if not specified, the default will be used.

  • overrides – optional dictionary of inputs to override the defaults of the protocol.

  • kwargs – additional keyword arguments that will be passed to the get_builder_from_protocol of all the sub processes that are called by this workchain.

Returns:

a process builder instance with all inputs defined ready for launch.

aiida_supercon.workflows.base module

Workchain to run a Quantum ESPRESSO pw.x calculation with automated error handling and restarts.

class aiida_supercon.workflows.base.EpwBaseWorkChain(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]

Bases: ProtocolMixin, BaseRestartWorkChain

Workchain to run a Quantum ESPRESSO pw.x calculation with automated error handling and restarts.

classmethod define(spec)[source]

Define the process specification.

classmethod get_builder_from_protocol(code, structure, protocol=None, overrides=None, parent_folder_nscf=None, parent_folder_ph=None, parent_folder_chk=None, parent_folder_epw=None, w90_chk_to_ukk_script=None, **_)[source]

Return a builder prepopulated with inputs selected according to the chosen protocol.

Parameters:

  • code – the Code instance configured for the quantumespresso.epw plugin.

  • protocol – protocol to use, if not specified, the default will be used.

  • overrides – optional dictionary of inputs to override the defaults of the protocol.

  • parent_folder_nscf – parent folder of the nscf calculation

  • parent_folder_ph – parent folder of the ph calculation

  • parent_folder_chk – parent folder of the chk calculation

  • parent_folder_epw – parent folder of the epw calculation

  • w90_chk_to_ukk_script – a julia script to convert the prefix.chk file (generated by wannier90.x) to a prefix.ukk file (to be used by epw.x)

Returns:

a process builder instance with all inputs defined ready for launch.

classmethod get_protocol_filepath()[source]

Return pathlib.Path to the .yaml file that defines the protocols.

handle_convergence_tc_linear_not_reached(calculation)[source]

Handle ERROR_CONVERGENCE_TC_LINEAR_NOT_REACHED: consider finished.

handle_known_unrecoverable_failure(calculation)[source]

Handle calculations with an exit status that correspond to a known failure mode that are unrecoverable.

These failures may always be unrecoverable or at some point a handler may be devised.

handle_unrecoverable_failure(calculation)[source]

Handle calculations with an exit status below 400 which are unrecoverable, so abort the work chain.

prepare_process()[source]

Prepare inputs for the next calculation.

Currently, no modifications to self.ctx.inputs are needed before submission. We rely on the parent run_process to create the builder.

report_error_handled(calculation, action)[source]

Report an action taken for a calculation that has failed.

This should be called in a registered error handler if its condition is met and an action was taken.

Parameters:

  • calculation – the failed calculation node

  • action – a string message with the action taken

setup()[source]

Call the setup of the BaseRestartWorkChain and create the inputs dictionary in self.ctx.inputs.

This self.ctx.inputs dictionary will be used by the EpwCalculation in the internal loop.

validate_kpoints()[source]

Validate the inputs related to k-points. epw.x requires coarse k-points and q-points to be compatible, which means the kpoints should be multiple of qpoints. e.g. if qpoints are [2,2,2], kpoints should be [2*l,2*m,2*n] for integer l,m,n. We firstly construct qpoints. Either an explicit KpointsData with given mesh/path, or a desired qpoints distance should be specified. In the case of the latter, the KpointsData will be constructed for the input StructureData using the create_kpoints_from_distance calculation function. Then we construct kpoints by multiplying the qpoints mesh by the kpoints_factor.

validate_parallelization()[source]

Validate the parallelization settings. epw.x requires npool == nprocs.

validate_parent_folders()[source]

Validate the parent folders. If the parent_folder_epw is provided, use it to get the coarse grid. And no other parent folders should be provided. If the parent_folder_epw is not provided, load the other parent folders, check if they are cleaned and get the coarse grid from them.

aiida_supercon.workflows.base.validate_inputs(inputs, ctx=None)[source]

Validator for the logic of providing parent folder inputs. It enforces that either parent_folder_epw is provided, OR the trio of nscf, ph, and chk folders are provided together.

aiida_supercon.workflows.intp module

Work chain for computing the critical temperature based off an EpwWorkChain.

class aiida_supercon.workflows.intp.EpwBaseIntpWorkChain(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]

Bases: ProtocolMixin, WorkChain

Base work chain for two-step interpolation workflows. It will run the EpwB2WWorkChain for electron-phonon coupling matrix on Wannier representation. And then an EpwBaseWorkChain for interpolation from Wannier to Bloch representation (fine grid). Based on the fine-grid electron-phonon coupling matrix, various quantities can be computed.

classmethod define(spec)[source]

Define the work chain specification.

classmethod get_builder_from_protocol(codes, structure, protocol=None, overrides=None, **kwargs)[source]

Return a builder prepopulated with inputs selected according to the chosen protocol. :param codes: The codes should be a dictionary with the following keys:

  • pw: The code for the pw.x calculation.

  • ph: The code for the ph.x calculation.

  • epw: The code for the epw.x calculation.

  • pw2wannier90: The code for the pw2wannier90.x calculation.

  • wannier: The code for the wannier90.x calculation.

Parameters:

  • structure – The structure.

  • protocol – The protocol.

  • overrides – The overrides.

Returns:

The builder.

static get_descendant(intp: WorkChainNode, link_label_filter: str) → WorkChainNode[source]

Get the descendant workchains of the intp workchain. :param intp: The intp workchain. :param link_label_filter: The link label filter. :return: The descendant workchain.

classmethod get_protocol_overrides() → dict[source]

Get the overrides for default protocol. :return: The overrides.

inspect_b2w()[source]

Verify that the epw.x workflow finished successfully. If the epw workflow passed, it will generate the parent folder for the following EpwBaseWorkChain. It will expose the outputs of the EpwB2WWorkChain as an intermediate results.

on_terminated()[source]

Clean up the work chain.

prepare_process()[source]

Prepare for the EpwBaseWorkChain workchain. It will update the parameters of the EpwBaseWorkChain with the parameters of the previous EpwB2WWorkChain.

results()[source]

It will expose the basic outputs of the EpwBaseWorkChain as a final results.

run_b2w()[source]

Run the restart EPW calculation for the current interpolation distance.

run_process()[source]

Run the EpwBaseWorkChain

setup()[source]

Setup steps, i.e. initialise context variables.

should_run_b2w()[source]

Check if the epw loop should continue or not. If ‘intp’ is not in the inputs, it will return False.

aiida_supercon.workflows.iso module

Work chain for computing the critical temperature based off an EpwWorkChain.

class aiida_supercon.workflows.iso.EpwIsoWorkChain(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]

Bases: EpwBaseIntpWorkChain

Work chain to compute the superconductivity based on Migdal-Eliashberg theory. This work chain will use isotropic approximation and solve the linearized Eliashberg equation.

classmethod define(spec)[source]

Define the work chain specification.

classmethod get_builder_from_protocol(codes, structure, protocol=None, overrides=None, **kwargs)[source]

Return a builder prepopulated with inputs selected according to the chosen protocol. :param codes: The codes should be a dictionary with the following keys:

  • pw: The code for the pw.x calculation.

  • ph: The code for the ph.x calculation.

  • epw: The code for the epw.x calculation.

  • pw2wannier90: The code for the pw2wannier90.x calculation.

  • wannier: The code for the wannier90.x calculation.

class aiida_supercon.workflows.EpwAnisoWorkChain(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]

Bases: EpwBaseIntpWorkChain

Work chain to compute the superconductivity based on anisotropic Migdal-Eliashberg theory. This workchain aims to implement the IR representation which allows calculation on low temperatures.

However, this version of epw.x made several changes that are not compatible with the previous versions.

  1. It fix the typo in previous versions, that is, eps_acustic -> eps_acoustic.

  2. The format of crystal.fmt file is changed. Previously it is:

    nat nmode nelec …

    And now it is:

    nat nmode nelec nbndskp …

  3. The epw.x from EPW 5.9 can’t prefix.ukk generated from wannier90. Not sure why but I can’t fix it.

  4. The epw.x from EPW 5.9 will try to read ‘vmedata.fmt’ even if I set vme = ‘dipole’.

    I would suggest to start only from the existing prefix.ephmat folder. But this requires another input code. I would temporarily mute use_ir.

classmethod define(spec)[source]

Define the work chain specification.

class aiida_supercon.workflows.EpwB2WWorkChain(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]

Bases: ProtocolMixin, WorkChain

Main work chain that orchestrates the Wannier90OptimizeWorkChain, PhBaseWorkChain and EpwBaseWorkChain.

This work chain is designed to transform the electron-phonon matrix from the Bloch basis (coarse grid) to the Wannier basis.

SOURCE_LIST = {'epw': ['crystal.fmt', 'dmedata.fmt', 'epwdata.fmt', 'dmedata.fmt', 'aiida.kgmap', 'aiida.kmap', 'aiida.ukk', 'out/aiida.epmatwp', 'save'], 'ph_base': ['DYN_MAT/dynamical-matrix-*', 'out/_ph0/aiida.dvscf1', 'out/_ph0/aiida.q_*/aiida.dvscf1']}
classmethod define(spec)[source]

Define the work chain specification.

generate_reciprocal_points()[source]

Generate the reciprocal points.

classmethod get_builder_from_protocol(codes, structure, protocol=None, overrides=None, wannier_projection_type=WannierProjectionType.ATOMIC_PROJECTORS_QE, w90_chk_to_ukk_script=None, band_kpoints=None, **kwargs) → ProcessBuilder[source]

Return a builder prepopulated with inputs according to the previous Wannier90OptimizeWorkChain and PhBaseWorkChain and protocol for other namespaces. :param codes: A dictionary of codes for the different calculations. Should be in the following format:

{

‘pw’: code pw.x, ‘ph’: code ph.x, ‘epw’: code epw.x, ‘pw2wannier90’: code pw2wannier90.x, ‘wannier’: code wannier90.x,

}

Parameters:

  • structure – the StructureData instance to use.

  • protocol – protocol to use, if not specified, the default will be used.

  • overrides – optional dictionary of inputs to override the defaults of the protocol.

  • kwargs – additional keyword arguments that will be passed to the get_builder_from_protocol of all the sub processes that are called by this workchain.

Returns:

a process builder instance with all inputs defined ready for launch.

class aiida_supercon.workflows.EpwBaseIntpWorkChain(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]

Bases: ProtocolMixin, WorkChain

Base work chain for two-step interpolation workflows. It will run the EpwB2WWorkChain for electron-phonon coupling matrix on Wannier representation. And then an EpwBaseWorkChain for interpolation from Wannier to Bloch representation (fine grid). Based on the fine-grid electron-phonon coupling matrix, various quantities can be computed.

classmethod define(spec)[source]

Define the work chain specification.

  • pw: The code for the pw.x calculation.

  • ph: The code for the ph.x calculation.

  • epw: The code for the epw.x calculation.

  • pw2wannier90: The code for the pw2wannier90.x calculation.

  • wannier: The code for the wannier90.x calculation.

Parameters:

  • structure – The structure.

  • protocol – The protocol.

  • overrides – The overrides.

class aiida_supercon.workflows.EpwBaseWorkChain(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]

Bases: ProtocolMixin, BaseRestartWorkChain

Workchain to run a Quantum ESPRESSO pw.x calculation with automated error handling and restarts.

classmethod define(spec)[source]

Define the process specification.

classmethod get_builder_from_protocol(code, structure, protocol=None, overrides=None, parent_folder_nscf=None, parent_folder_ph=None, parent_folder_chk=None, parent_folder_epw=None, w90_chk_to_ukk_script=None, **_)[source]

Return a builder prepopulated with inputs selected according to the chosen protocol.

Parameters:

  • code – the Code instance configured for the quantumespresso.epw plugin.

  • protocol – protocol to use, if not specified, the default will be used.

  • overrides – optional dictionary of inputs to override the defaults of the protocol.

  • parent_folder_nscf – parent folder of the nscf calculation

  • parent_folder_ph – parent folder of the ph calculation

  • parent_folder_chk – parent folder of the chk calculation

  • parent_folder_epw – parent folder of the epw calculation

  • w90_chk_to_ukk_script – a julia script to convert the prefix.chk file (generated by wannier90.x) to a prefix.ukk file (to be used by epw.x)

Returns:

a process builder instance with all inputs defined ready for launch.

classmethod get_protocol_filepath()[source]

Return pathlib.Path to the .yaml file that defines the protocols.

handle_convergence_tc_linear_not_reached(calculation)[source]

Handle ERROR_CONVERGENCE_TC_LINEAR_NOT_REACHED: consider finished.

handle_known_unrecoverable_failure(calculation)[source]

Handle calculations with an exit status that correspond to a known failure mode that are unrecoverable.

These failures may always be unrecoverable or at some point a handler may be devised.

handle_unrecoverable_failure(calculation)[source]

Handle calculations with an exit status below 400 which are unrecoverable, so abort the work chain.

prepare_process()[source]

Prepare inputs for the next calculation.

Currently, no modifications to self.ctx.inputs are needed before submission. We rely on the parent run_process to create the builder.

report_error_handled(calculation, action)[source]

Report an action taken for a calculation that has failed.

This should be called in a registered error handler if its condition is met and an action was taken.

Parameters:

  • calculation – the failed calculation node

  • action – a string message with the action taken

setup()[source]

Call the setup of the BaseRestartWorkChain and create the inputs dictionary in self.ctx.inputs.

This self.ctx.inputs dictionary will be used by the EpwCalculation in the internal loop.

validate_kpoints()[source]

Validate the inputs related to k-points. epw.x requires coarse k-points and q-points to be compatible, which means the kpoints should be multiple of qpoints. e.g. if qpoints are [2,2,2], kpoints should be [2*l,2*m,2*n] for integer l,m,n. We firstly construct qpoints. Either an explicit KpointsData with given mesh/path, or a desired qpoints distance should be specified. In the case of the latter, the KpointsData will be constructed for the input StructureData using the create_kpoints_from_distance calculation function. Then we construct kpoints by multiplying the qpoints mesh by the kpoints_factor.

validate_parallelization()[source]

Validate the parallelization settings. epw.x requires npool == nprocs.

validate_parent_folders()[source]

Validate the parent folders. If the parent_folder_epw is provided, use it to get the coarse grid. And no other parent folders should be provided. If the parent_folder_epw is not provided, load the other parent folders, check if they are cleaned and get the coarse grid from them.

class aiida_supercon.workflows.EpwIsoWorkChain(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]

Bases: EpwBaseIntpWorkChain

Work chain to compute the superconductivity based on Migdal-Eliashberg theory. This work chain will use isotropic approximation and solve the linearized Eliashberg equation.
